review_title: Good for starting out as a teacher
pros: Expectations for students are set high in order to maintain enrollment. And this is not a visa school, so students tend to show up and try to learn. The school has a lot of teaching resources, though some are out of date. Great fellow teachers and supportive office staff. The program means well.
cons: Not enough communication between entities. Orders come from on-high, often with little warning, and there is very little actual discourse between teachers and directors, and zero interaction among teachers. Most of the teaching facilities are cluttered and in need of an upgrade.

job_title: Head Evening Instructor  in New York, NY
pros: Working t US has it's perks. It is a professional environment and mostly office work (at least for the Adult Literacy Department). 3 days in office 2 from home. Opportunities for students in the program to work in the office. No real discussion or advocacy for their rights, which feels a little advantageous on the company's part... though probably unintentional.
cons: They take feedback in theory, but not in practice and management can be a little controlling/hypercritical. Other than that, it's a pretty good environment to work and grow.

pros: I get to do whatever I want. I can hire my friends and not have to work the whole week just to enough. I can really kind of slack off with unlimited screw off time and even earn more money working for someone else. there's not a lot of work for us to do we just give it to the low paid little people. just need to show up and make Melissa look good. which doesn't really require a lot.
cons: it's kind of gross to watch the place Fall apart

job_title: Teacher Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Working for kids is a rewarding job
cons: They under pay, say one thing and then do another, they try to hide things from the staff and the parents of the kids

pros: Staff and administrators are extremely supportive
cons: Great opportunity for community support

review_title: Good place to get food in door
pros: It has some unionized positions.
cons: It’s a non profit so take what you can from that

pros: many, including collegiality and high quality facilities, performance opportunities, excellent leadership

pros: The Training And Lessons Thought By My Employer Has Helped Me Develop Into A Better Staff as It Has Given Me More Qualities Like Being A Hardworker , Being Creative, Thinking Critically, And Finding Solutions

pros: The people that you serve

job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker LCSW in New York, NY

cons: racist and discriminative director who favors people to create a non-inclusive work environment for same-level peers.

pros: Lots of training Family oriented Doe Schedule
cons: Little hours No room for growth

pros: The people you work with make it worth it. The communities we serve depend on us to come to work and be efficient. Having a positive work environment makes coming to work worth it all.
cons: There are no Cons with this job it is flexible.

pros: The location I worked for had a great director that cared about their employees.
cons: Not much room for promotions.

job_title: Part Time Adult Literacy Instructor in New York, NY
pros: I love working with the students. They are wonderful and eager to learn.
cons:
The program seems to focus heavily on the day time students. So the night time and weekend employees schedules aren't considered for meetings and PD's. The program can be really restrictive. I.E., remote learning, professional development options. 

However and unfortunately this is not their fault as their hands are often tied by the guidelines of their funders or city partners.

pros: Flexibility, Caring and Great Staff.
cons: No overtime work, low starting salaries.

pros: Learned new objective. Helped many people.
cons: They didn’t train you and expected so much. Benefits were trash

pros: Best culture, people, and environment

pros: caring boss. flexibility. good for college students
cons: Not enough money for the work being done. Kind of toxic. Focuses too much on trying to be perfect when there is no such thing.

pros: coworkers are very nice and will work as a team, management is great
cons: short hours due to the after-school program

job_title: College Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: Most full time staff are unionized - and maybe because of this, the benefits and time off policies are very good for the non-profit social services sector. Oldest settlement house in the US.
cons: Such a large organization that it is impossible (for me) to feel a part of a community. Every program kind of just does its own thing.

review_title: Great to get your feet wet
pros: The day care system is pretty simple, the lessons are mostly planned out due to the curriculum used, there is room for creativity as far as the activities you are doing with the littles.
cons: The pay is awful, at most 45k (with degrees & certifications). Full year of work (only national holidays: Thanks Giving, X-mas, President's, 4th, New Yrs, Labor, Memorial) poor training and support from admin. Staff Development is geared more towards the whole settlement and ot geared towards working with students.

review_title: Unionized environment, same internal structure for decades
pros:
Has adjusted well to the pandemic by implementing online programs and adopting the basic technologies required to support it.
Friendly staff that values their work.
cons: Lacks middle management positions and new blood that brings different perspectives on addressing issues.

pros: Good insurance, allot of days off
cons: No time to take your PTO . Crazy working hours, because you need to do allot of overtime and still you can’t catch up. They need to hire more people.

review_title: great pay for a new graduate

pros: great pay for a new graduate, very active position in different places
cons: challenging work, lots of paperwork

review_title: Organization is great on paper, not in real-time
pros: The kids, working with kids from different cultures, financial backgrounds and education structures was a nice blend.
cons: Lacks Leadership, Knowledge, Organization, from HR to the Director was pure disfunction as in they didn't know their left from their right and had to retract their information most of the time; no direction, leadership or knowledge from Director, no knowledge of the kids school schedule, contact or attendance. Director displayed favoritism with staff, i.e. inappropriate staff placing/titles (no background/knowledge of position). Director didn't have/show follow through on complaints or issues; numbers were more important than the people, meetings about meetings for meetings regarding meetings was more important.

job_title: Licensed Physical Therapist Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Nice people, great place to work! Loved it!
cons: Unorganized, outdated, lack strategy, and what else

pros: The children are great and some staff are kind.  Pay is decent and benefits could be better.
cons: Upper management is atrocious.  They lie, choose favorites and ignore you sometimes. Very stressful work environment,  teachers are not listened to. Lack of trust  within teachers and upper management.

review_title: Terrible, wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy
pros: The kids are great to work with
cons:
-covid-19 case broke out in the building and while all other classrooms were told to close, I was mandated to stay with my group of kids even though we had direct contact with the person who had the virus (not to mention my boss was working from home) I personally had to beg my boss to close our classroom as well and proceeded to say "but then I will have no stay" showing the concern of running the business than the safety of the staff and attendees.
- Clear favoritism 
-Management does not take complaints seriously
-Poor Management 
-Managers expect people below them to do their work
-pretends to care but really doesn't
-we are extremely understaffed and they still want to add more kids

review_title: Great Place to Work, Inspiring Individuals to Work With

pros: Flexibility to be creative. Friendly coworkers and supervisors

review_title: This Organization Does Nothing for the Communities
pros: The idea of providing counseling and language classes to communities is a very good one. It definitely did not come from the brain trust at the site I worked at.
cons: Racist staff who made fun of students' accents, catty co-workers who resented their lack of promotion, leadership that simply followed order from on top. Overall the sturcture of this organization, it's true aims need to be looked at on a federal level.

job_title: After School Teacher in New York, NY
pros: Some of the best faculty you'll meet at a school. Everyone is there because they love working with kids.

cons: No upward movement. Not a lot of room for advancement.....

review_title: A great place to start your career
job_title: Family Child Specialist in New York, NY
pros: supportive of your career pursuits
cons: pay is low compared with other similar agencies

review_title: A great place to work, with great people.
pros: Definitely the coworkers and work environment is fantastic here. Working for a great cause with people who are extremely dedicated to what they do, is always a wonderful thing. Laid back atmosphere, practical and caring management team. Clients who are equally wonderful and appreciative of what the organizations does for them.
cons:
The atmosphere is sometimes too relaxed and can have a aura of non professionalism at times. It's also a non-profit so some individuals are over worked and need more support.
The Salary is competitive in some programs and others it's definitely below the benchmark for  even a non-profit.

review_title: Enjoyed working with the children, but some of the other staff don't seem to like kids??
job_title: After School Child Care Worker in Toronto, ON
pros: My manager Nicole was absolutely lovely, but I think she has left the job. Great kids besides pretty normal behaviour issues, always enjoyed working there, they put a good amount of faith in their employees, and I was paid an excellent salary.
cons: Some of the other after school care workers were not great with kids, and one or two seemed to straight up hate children.  There was a strong culture of just supervising the children rather than participating and facilitating play and activities. This was frustrating to see, but I did my best to keep the quality of the children's experience high.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: None- everything comes at a price and all the "employee perks" are only in place so the agency has the appearance of treating their staff well
cons: As in previous reviews, upper management is unprofessional; and that's is putting it very kindly. There is an absolute lack of diversity in upper management and operations are conducted based on what the leadership's mood is that day and their personal agenda. Staff appears to be valued on a superficial level, but with time, it is evident that there is no respect afforded to anyone but the ones at the very top, and they are eager to retaliate against anyone who goes against their agenda.

review_title: Good people but bad place to work
job_title: Case Manager in New York, NY
pros: My co-workers were great and we are working to help those in dire straits. The goal of the organization is on-target. We worked in a program called "Project Home" where we work to re-settle people who are homeless. We hook them up with housing, food, social services, food stamps, and everything else they need. The people at Project Home are serious about helping those in need.
cons: Awful work environment and bad manamgement. My boss was a chain smoker and she smoked in the office all of the time. The pay was  very, very low and the medical benefits were piss poor. We worked day and night to get people the medical benefits and housing they need, but we hardly made enough to live.

review_title: Stressful environment, Families and children are no longer priority
pros: some of the staff are caring.
cons: New management are not professionals, treating staff very poorly,  extremely stressful environment,  lots of staff leaving and/or looking to get out.  Many complaints from parents that are not been heard by upper management.  The good caring staff are leaving and being replaced by staff not reflecting of the neighborhood, very sad, this program used to be a great place for families and children but no longer the case. Program out of compliance because they can fill out classrooms as before because parents are leaving and going to better managed day care sites.

job_title: Family Assessment Worker in New York, NY
pros: Good health insurance with low copays. 19 days of vacation. Unionized position so long as not in management. Learned a lot about social service and various resources for the LES community. Good work life balance, if you work late then you can come in later the next day or take the hours back.
cons: High turnover in management and front line staff. Coworkers not as motivated. Management focuses on numbers rather than quality.

pros: The clients are amazing and really motivate you to continue a high level of engagement and work. Work environment is fine, many issues handled promptly.
cons: Managers do not always have experience in your field, which makes it difficult when issues occur. Instead of being able to rely on your supervisor to brainstorm ways around a client issue, you have to overly rely on your coworkers, who are already over extended.

pros: Part of the job is to help the clients pick out what they need which is nice as it gives you a chance of how your help has an impact on people. Also, management team and other volunteers are nice and easy to get along with.
cons: I'd say the lack of plannings, it seems like they came up with their plans a minute before they suggest it which is not that bad but planning and organizing everything ahead can save more time.

review_title: Awful place for both staff and families
job_title: Teacher Assistant in New York, NY
pros: You still have some good staff left
cons: Upper management are heartless and inconsiderate, their only priority is their personal agenda. Making changes without warning and disrespectful behavior towards staff and families. No longer getting children registered due to bad reputation. Last year the program was on the news due to negligence of management for not informing parents of pervasive contagious conditions in the classroom.  The good staff are leaving in big numbers.  Teachers leaving and new staff that are not trained or familiar with culture of the neighborhood.

review_title: I feel my work at University Settlement is appreciated and there is effective communication with managers and staff.
job_title: Group Leader in New York, NY
pros: The company’s culture motivates staff to work at their best. The company had a yearly staff development day in which their staff is appreciated for their hard work throughout the year.
cons: Depending on the position a person has, there isn’t much room to advance within the organization. Some former coworkers have felt that they were overlooked and looked for employment elsewhere

pros: Big social services nonprofit. They do a LOT and the work they do is high-quality, comprehensive, and concentrated on solving some of the most important problems in NYC. Great health care. Pretty bad pay.
cons: Low pay. High turnover. While the work they do is good, US can move like molasses when it comes to making changes in the way they operate.

review_title: Learned a lot, but so much could have been better!
pros:
Access to a wide range of people and organizations. 
Helps the community.
cons:
No organization. 
No management for the management. 
Unfair treatment to employees. No room to grow. 
No benefits.

job_title: Student Teacher in New York, NY
pros: The classes for the after-school for their Beacon Program are well-staffed so it's not hard to find help with the students and class.
cons: It's hard to find a supervising figure at times. Sometimes you can go the whole day without seeing your supervisor which is frustrating when you need them to sign off on something.

job_title: Marketing Associate in New York, NY
pros: Organization doing some very important work. Some extremely hardworking people who take on a million jobs at once.
cons:
- Very high turnover in Development Department
- Strategically rudderless management that provides little professional development. 
- Sense of always rushing. Everything is the most important!
- Little understanding of how marketing should feed into revenue.
- Very political environment. 
- Expectation that you take on every job (it's a nonprofit - and that's part of environment - but US/The Door/BSA makes CYA tasks a priority)

review_title: Varies on department, overall good morale and community investment
pros: I have worked in multiple departments including housing and older adults. In many departments there are really great, passionate and supportive staff.
cons: In some departments there is high turnover and at times low morale and bad attitudes from upper management.

pros: Dedicated colleagues, meaningful work with families, unionized job with annual salary increases, regular hours with encouragement  to utilize vacation/personal days, emphasis on self-care
cons: Management choices in terms of selection of cases, stressful cases, lack of supervision, no room for growth

pros:

pros: Good co-workers. Very patient to teach you what you need to know.
